page.title: 07THE CHURCH
page.content: Services are held in the church every Sunday. These are usually taken by the Vicar. The main service is held on the first Sunday in the month, when a Family Communion service is held. The children go to a Sunday School at the same time as the service is held in the church. They come in to the church during the offertory and go to the Altar rail for blessing before the adults receive communion. This has proved a very worthwhile service and congregations of 70 people usually attend. The vicar is the Rev. Frank Hung who is the first Non-European to be a vicar in the Salisbury Diocese. He was born in China and came to England when he was two years old. A new floor is being put into the church as the old one was rotting.
